comments.html: I add cisco search to my firefox search bar.
comments.name: honestnetworker

comments.html:
I use the "site:cisco.com" term regularly, but I never thought to use the "inurl:xxx" to find version-specific stuff.

Keep up the good work.
comments.name: Aaron

comments.html:
... and for my CCIE study process i used very often:

site:cisco.com/univercd

do search the DocCD online with google.

HTH
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
You can use http://ready.to/search/en/# to create an open search plugin for firefox to automate the search...

Eg

http://ready.to/search/en/?sna=Search+IOS+12.0&prf=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fhl%3Den%26amp%3Bq%3D%26quot%3B&suf=%26quot%3B%2Bsite%253Acisco.com%2Binurl%253Aios120%26amp%3BbtnG%3DSearch%26amp%3Bmeta%3D&des=Searches+the+cisco.com+domain+for+the+search+term+in+the+12.0+documentation&in=utf&ou=ono&mod=pn
comments.name: Anonymous
